title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks

content.rendered:
What are Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks?

Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks process insurance policies and add changes to already existing ones. A lot of their time is concerned with accurately completing records and claims forms.

Where do Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks work?

  • Insurance companies
  • Employment services
  • Technical consulting services

How much do Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks is $42,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Business majors
  • Economics majors
Explore roles on Handshake

Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerk skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks succeed in their work:

  • Strong attention to detail
  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Organizational skills
  • Great typing skills

What are some common questions about Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks?

Q: How do I become an insurance claims clerk?

A: Some employers will ask for a bachelor’s degree in a related field, and others will only require that you have your high school diploma.
